meanings.definition: The act of checking or adjusting a measuring instrument to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent1: During the calibration of the thermometer, the technician made sure it showed the correct temperature.
meanings.sent2: The calibration of the scale on the ruler was necessary to measure the length accurately.
meanings.sent3: The calibration of the clock turned into a fun challenge as the hands kept moving unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: Her sense of time was like a well-calibrated clock, always accurate and reliable.
meanings.sent5: The calibration of the compass was crucial for the explorers to find their way through the dense forest.

meanings.definition: The process of marking a scale on a measuring instrument.
meanings.sent1: The calibration of the ruler involved marking the inches and centimeters clearly.
meanings.sent2: Precision in the calibration of the weighing scale was essential for accurate measurements.
meanings.sent3: The calibration of the measuring tape became a colorful task as each mark was carefully added.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail in the calibration of the ruler was like an artist painting fine lines.
meanings.sent5: The calibration of the speedometer was done meticulously to ensure safe driving on the road.

meanings.definition: The act of standardizing or adjusting a device or system to a known reference.
meanings.sent1: The calibration of the machine was necessary to align it with the industry standards.
meanings.sent2: In the calibration of the computer system, each component was adjusted for optimal performance.
meanings.sent3: The calibration of the robot's movements turned into a dance routine as it followed the set pattern.
meanings.sent4: His ability to adapt to new situations was like the calibration of a versatile tool, always ready for any task.
meanings.sent5: The calibration of the telescope allowed astronomers to observe distant stars with precision.
